title: Penguins EDA
text:
Code
library(palmerpenguins)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)




Code
# Make a persistent DB and store the connection in a variable.
con <- DBI::dbConnect(
  duckdb::duckdb(),
  dbdir = "my-db.duckdb"
  )

# Write an R dataframe (penguins) into a DuckDB table. 
DBI::dbWriteTable(conn = con,
                  name = "penguins",
                  value = palmerpenguins::penguins,
                  overwrite = TRUE)




Code
library(dbplyr)

# Query the data in the database.
df <- dplyr::tbl(con, "penguins")

# Summarise the data and extract (collect) the data as a dataframe.
df %>%
  group_by(species, sex) %>%
  summarise(
    across(
        ends_with("mm") | ends_with("g"),
      \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)
      )
    ) %>%
  dplyr::collect() %>%
  knitr::kable()

title: Penguins EDA
section: Penguin Size vs Mass by Species
text:
Penguin Size vs Mass by Species


Code
df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")











Code
# Disconnect from the database.
DBI::dbDisconnect(con, shutdown = TRUE)

title: Model
text:
Code
import seaborn as sns
from pandas import get_dummies
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn import preprocessing

title: Model
text:
Get Data


Code
df = sns.load_dataset("penguins").dropna()

df.head(3)

title: Model
text:
Define Model and Fit


Code
X = get_dummies(df[['bill_length_mm', 'species', 'sex']], drop_first = True)
y = df['body_mass_g']

model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y)

title: Model
text:
Get some information


Code
print(f"R^2 {model.score(X,y)}")
print(f"Intercept {model.intercept_}")
print(f"Columns {X.columns}")
print(f"Coefficients {model.coef_}")


R^2 0.8555368759537614
Intercept 2169.269720939403
Columns Index(['bill_length_mm', 'species_Chinstrap', 'species_Gentoo', 'sex_Male'], dtype='object')
Coefficients [  32.53688677 -298.76553447 1094.86739145  547.36692408]

title: Exploring the Palmer Penguins Data
text:
This site contains two pages of interest:

EDA - to explore the palmerpenguins data.
Model - to calculate statistical values after fitting a linear regression model on the data.

title: Penguin Predictor App
text: This site shows the EDA of the palmerpenguins data.

title: Model
text:
Code
import seaborn as sns
from pandas import get_dummies
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn import preprocessing

title: Model
text:
Get Data


Code
import duckdb
import seaborn as sns

con = duckdb.connect('my-db.duckdb')
df = sns.load_dataset("penguins").dropna()
con.execute('CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE penguins AS SELECT * FROM df')
con.close()

con = duckdb.connect('my-db.duckdb')
df = con.execute("SELECT * FROM penguins").fetchdf().dropna()
con.close()

title: Model
text:
Define Model and Fit


Code
X = get_dummies(df[['bill_length_mm', 'species', 'sex']], drop_first = True)
y = df['body_mass_g']

model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y)

title: Model
text:
Get some information


Code
print(f"R^2 {model.score(X,y)}")
print(f"Intercept {model.intercept_}")
print(f"Columns {X.columns}")
print(f"Coefficients {model.coef_}")


R^2 0.8555368759537614
Intercept 2169.269720939403
Columns Index(['bill_length_mm', 'species_Chinstrap', 'species_Gentoo', 'sex_Male'], dtype='object')
Coefficients [  32.53688677 -298.76553447 1094.86739145  547.36692408]




Code
from vetiver import VetiverModel
v = VetiverModel(model, model_name="penguin_model", prototype_data=X)




Code
import os
from tempfile import mkdtemp

# Create a temporary directory to store the app.py file for testing
tmpdir = "." + mkdtemp()

if not os.path.exists(tmpdir):
    # Create the directory
    os.makedirs(tmpdir)
    print("Directory created successfully!")

# Create a directory to use as the pin board
board_directory = "data/model"

# Check if the directory already exists
if not os.path.exists(board_directory):
    # Create the directory
    os.makedirs(board_directory)
    print("Directory created successfully!")


Directory created successfully!




Code
import pins
from pins import board_folder
from vetiver import VetiverModel
from vetiver import VetiverAPI
from vetiver import vetiver_pin_write
from vetiver import write_app

# Create a pin board and save (pin) the model
model_board = pins.board_folder(path="data/model", versioned=True, allow_pickle_read=True)

# Pin the model to the board
vetiver_pin_write(model_board, v)
if not os.path.exists(f"{board_directory}/penguin_model.py"):
  write_app(model_board, "penguin_model", file=tmpdir + "/penguin_model.py")


Model Cards provide a framework for transparent, responsible reporting. 
 Use the vetiver `.qmd` Quarto template as a place to start, 
 with vetiver.model_card()
Writing pin:
Name: 'penguin_model'
Version: 20240405T085835Z-24ce6




Code
app = VetiverAPI(v, check_prototype=True)
#app.run(port=8080)
